MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetNameCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the text label of the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName%2A>.
Docs.returns: The string that contains the label.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name property can be thought of as the string of text that a user would use to explain which control is being referred to. It is important to have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object GetPattern(valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the control pattern for the that is associated with this .
Docs.returns: An object that supports the control pattern if is a supported value; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If one of the following cases occurs, this method returns the current <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> object.
- `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> has child <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects.
- `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> does not have child <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects.
- `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> has its checkable property set to `true`.
If `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName>, this method returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider> interface.
